channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds from top to bottom of Queens Row, 15th August
item.description:
Weeds on path top to bottom of Queens Row SE17, In the winter it's street covered in leaves on path or mushey in road hardly ever touched. Looks a mess unkempt abd uncredited for

item.title: Cleaning issue, 15th August
item.description:

item.title: Screw sticking out on children’s play equipment, 15th August
item.description:
The main climbing frame with rope bridge is dangerous. It is missing the protective yellow cap over the screw which means the sharp part of the screw is exposed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wrotham Road, East Wickham, London

item.title: Mayplace Ave & Maiden Ave needs to be swept, 15th August
item.description:
I am kindly asking why is our road not getting cleaned what so ever ( Mayplace Avenue ). Road is plastered in rubbish!! Its like living in 3rd World country!!! Why are we getting ignored? We are home owners/ tax payers. Not mentioning Maiden Lane road which is most likely dirtiest road in whole country. Many report being placed by myself and nothing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Avenue, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside No 19-21 Ariel Road, 15th August
item.description:
A construction company are carrying out extensive building work the materials and portable toilets are on the road, they have skips on the road, as they unwrap the building materials plastic covers are on the pavement making it dangerous for disabled or the partially sighted. Vehicles constantly block the road. The planning permission for a rear extension seems to be more like a whole three story extension a full truck load of steels were delivered taking two hours to unload
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-22, Ariel Road, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose step, 15th August
item.description:
Reported this before and you said no defect. Well that is incorrect. The stairs by the pointy statue that lead up towards London Bridge station have a loose step on them. It is the second step down keeps moving out. In danger of falling off and could cause a serious injury. Please can this once and for all be fixed. If you go and inspect you will see which step it is. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tooley Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
